metadata.title: CVE-2022-1771 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Uncontrolled Recursion in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4975.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1771` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
vim-athena - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
vim-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
vim-gnome - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
vim-gtk - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
vim-gui-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
vim-nox - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
vim-runtime - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
vim-tiny - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
xxd - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.13+esm7').
